SEARCH
Package se.kth.iv1350.groceryStore.model

Class CurrentSale

java.lang.Object
se.kth.iv1350.groceryStore.model.CurrentSale
public class CurrentSale extends Object
This class represents the current sale. It contains a list of items and methods for managing and updating the current sale.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CurrentSale()
    Creates an instance of CurrentSale with an empty list of items, and sets the value of VAT to 12%.

  • Method Summary

    Processes a payment for the sale with the given amount and creates a Payment object.

  • Constructor Details

    • CurrentSale

      public CurrentSale()
      Creates an instance of CurrentSale with an empty list of items, and sets the value of VAT to 12%.

  • Method Details

    • addItem

      public void addItem(ItemDTO foundItem)
      Adds an item to the current sale. If the item already exists in the list, its quantity is increased by 1. If the item does not exist in the list, a new item is created with quantity 1. Updates the running total and total price incl. VAT.
      Parameters:
      foundItem - the ItemDTO to be added to the current sale

    • getRunningTotal

      public double getRunningTotal()
      Returns the current running total of the sale.
      Returns:
      the running total

    • getVAT

      public double getVAT()
      Returns the VAT of the sale.
      Returns:
      the VAT value

    • getTotalPriceInclVAT

      public double getTotalPriceInclVAT()
      Returns the total price including VAT of the sale.
      Returns:
      the total price including VAT

    • print

      public void print(StringBuilder builder)
      Prints the list of items in the current sale to a StringBuilder.
      Parameters:
      builder - the StringBuilder object used for building the output.

    • pay

      public void pay(double amountPaid)
      Processes a payment for the sale with the given amount and creates a Payment object.
      Parameters:
      amountPaid - the amount paid by the customer
